intro: Cota tinctoria subsp. gaudium-solis, commonly known as the Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ornamental use and traditional dyeing practices.
